page.title: 11VILLAGE LIFE IN SHRAWARDINE
page.content:
Our home is a cottage which was once the house of a farm worker employed on the Montford Estate. It stands alongside a bridlepath which runs from Shrawardine to Montford, two small villages south of the A5.
Shrawardine is a peaceful, picturesque village with no pub, no village hall, a miniscule post office and a beautiful sandstone church set on a rise with a magnificent view of the Welsh Breidden Hills.
Village activities centre around the preservation of the church and include annual hunter trials and a tri-annual Flower Festival. Wildlife abounds along the bridleway, stoats, weasels, foxes and hares being frequently seen, as well as yellow hammers, kestrels, owls, bullfinches and many others.
